snippet.textDisplay: False positive is a double edge sword.  It means you could still be susceptible and the virus is not going away any time soon, it is endemic.   A true positive with no symptoms is in some ways better.   Testing has very limited value when the virus is already endemic and the test is giving a binary result that is not a good guide to infectivity.  Asymptomatic transmission is not the driver of epidemics.   People might even be spreading it by going to test centres.
snippet.textOriginal: False positive is a double edge sword.  It means you could still be susceptible and the virus is not going away any time soon, it is endemic. snippet.textDisplay: Thanks professor, love your show! Question: why did you attribute more reliability to the second test? If they were both as reliable as each other, you must conclude that the second test was a false negative (so would need a third test to break the tie), or that you could well have been an asymptomatic carrier. Stay safe, keep educating the world!

snippet.textDisplay:
As part of a national strategy a Ct value is chosen as a threshold value. The subjects do not need to know this threshold, just as they do not need to know the reasons for its value. The threshold is a compromise between accuracy, disruption, containment. At that level it is *all* statistics and politics.

 A simple case.
Say you can (as a government) choose between:
missing 50% of positive cases but only have 5% false positives
Or
missing only 5% of positive cases but have 50% false positives.

You need to choose between aggressive containment at the cost of some needless confinement or fewer false positives but with longer need for restrictions for everyone.

snippet.textDisplay: Spot on. I would say that any test result is not valid if no Ct value is quoted. Strong suspicion that certain organisations are deliberately using high numbers to create flawed results. Also, later in this item is a useful of timing between infection and test time. The timing of when it’s done is generally brushed over by the usual suspects. In the real world, many of the so-called positive results are probably wrong w.r.t. anyone being a risk to a third party at all.

snippet.textDisplay:
Thank you for this excellent explanation! PCR testing and false positives make sense now, it was something that has confused me a bit since we began with pcr testing. 
I wonder if doing follow up testing on all pcr tests with a high ct, say over 20, would help weed out more false positives.

snippet.textDisplay: Wow, this is one of THE BEST vids I have watched on Covid.  Granted I'm a noob in all this, but false Covid tests have bothered me and they create a doubt in me (and others) about logic and medicine.  But this was very easy to follow when you explained it with a simple use-case (as yourself), and the way you explained it, has helped me trust in logic and science.  Thanks very much for this vid, and would so much love if you make more vids on the Immune System theory, Th1/Th2/Innate dominance/components, how various simple ailments, nasal congestion, rhinitus, chilblains, mast cell disorder etc, they work (or atleast theorized to work) in terms of immune system components (TH cell types, Neutrophils, Macrophages, Mast etc).

snippet.textDisplay: As an addendum to my previous comment,  the testing labs for COVID-19 here in Southern California have a reputation both anecdotally and online in consumer ratings, for overbilling, double billing, not providing results, long delays in providing results, having not phone number for billing or other inquiries, employing "clowns in white lab coats" ( as one educated person reported), etc., etc.    This is a big problem that needs prompt fixing, especially with COVID-19 numbers increasing.     The test costs often are $500 or more per test, and this is often after insurance pays for a portion of the testing.     It almost seems both a scam and a means to diminish testing to reduce the numbers for political reasons.    Thankfully, Trump will soon be gone, but in the intervening months, his incompetence can cause considerable death and destruction.

snippet.textDisplay: Thanks so much for the explanation. You are the most calm person who has been tested positive that I know! :D
snippet.textOriginal: Thanks so much for the explanation. You are the most calm person who has been tested positive that I know! :D

snippet.textDisplay: First of all, thank you for TWIV.  I started listening in March and haven't missed many episodes since I began listening.  It has been very helpful.  I do have to disagree with your final conclusion though.  While it is unlikely you are in an early upswing in your infection, it is somewhat likely your PCR test was nearing it's LOD with a CT value so high and by the time you retested, it was below threshold, lowering the sensitivity of your follow up PCR test. I would only agree it was a false positive if you were antibody negative at this point. Thanks again for TWIV!
snippet.textOriginal: First of all, thank you for TWIV.  I started listening in March and haven't missed many episodes since I began listening.  It has been very helpful.  I do have to disagree with your final conclusion though.  While it is unlikely you are in an early upswing in your infection, it is somewhat likely your PCR test was nearing it's LOD with a CT value so high and by the time you retested, it was below threshold, lowering the sensitivity of your follow up PCR test. I would only agree it was a false positive if you were antibody negative at this point. Thanks again for TWIV!

snippet.textDisplay:
But you should be able to see mine:
CT = 34.7? I thought it should be integer.  Or is your value average values of number of tests? Anyways, Prof, you know that this is not a standard test at all. The Q-tip swab or whatever they are doing for PCR Test, the amount of stuff you get into the Q-tip is not standardized. So let assume in your sample, the amount of stuff collected is 1/4th, that means your CT value should have to be then 36.7. Or if you got amount of sample on Q-tip 8 times more, then the CT value would  be 31.7. That's why this PCR Test is bullshit, bogues, and I can't believe how so many scientists are not voicing enough.. and simply keep mum against all bullshit narratives shoved into people's faces by these MSM, TVs, WHO, CDC, NIH, NHS.. this is criminal act  they are engaging to cause massive hardships upon the population and torturing this.
